args.natural_language_statement: Formalize: Let f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù and a b : ‚Ñù with a ‚â§ b. Assume f is bounded on [a,b]. /-- Formalize: Let f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù and a b : ‚Ñù with a ‚â§ b. Assume f is bounded on [a,b]. args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- If f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù is bounded on [a,b] and there is a sequence of partitions P k of [a,b]
    with upper_sum (P k) - lower_sum (P k) ‚Üí 0, then f is Riemann integrable on [a,b]
    and the Riemann integral equals the common limit of the upper and lower sums. -/
theorem riemann_integrable_of_partition_limits {f : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù} {a b : ‚Ñù} (hab : a ‚â§ b)
  (hf_bdd : ‚àÉ M, ‚àÄ x ‚àà Set.Icc a b, |f x| ‚â§ M)
  {Partition : ‚Ñù ‚Üí ‚Ñù ‚Üí Type _} {upper_sum lower_sum : ‚àÄ {a' b' : ‚Ñù}, Partition a' b' ‚Üí ‚Ñù}
  (P : ‚Ñï ‚Üí Partition a b)
  (h_diff_tendsto_zero : Tendsto (fun k => upper_sum (P k) - lower_sum (P k)) atTop (ùìù 0)) :
  RiemannIntegrable f a b ‚àß
  (‚àÉ I : ‚Ñù, (‚à´ x in a..b, f x) = I ‚àß
    Tendsto (fun k => upper_sum (P k)) atTop (ùìù I) ‚àß
    Tendsto (fun k => lower_sum (P k)) atTop (ùìù I)) := by sorry
